sentence.Network_cn: 他们通过听众捐款的方式筹集了63万美元后宣告结束。

sentence.Network_en: Dr Brian was a good listener.
sentence.Network_cn: 布莱恩医生会耐心倾听他人说话。

sentence.Network_en: I felt it politic to keep my peace and play the part of the attentive listener.
sentence.Network_cn: 我觉得保持沉默、做一名专心的听众比较明智。

encyclopedia.content: 名词n. 1. 、听者，倾听者 If you've got any problems, she's a good listener. 要是你有什么烦心的事，她会耐心听你倾诉。 2、 收听者，听众之一 Good night, listeners! 美好夜晚收听者们 3、 监听器 4、 收听站包包品牌品牌概念： 2007 年3月份，由发迹于东京都町田的知名古著店Trashbox有限公司创立的包包品牌，设计师为矶部爱里，毕业於东京文化服装学院，设计出流行感与机能性兼备的包款，迅速在日本年轻人间窜红，商品上

entry.tran: （电台广播的）收听者，听众之一
entry.def: A listener is a person who listens to the radio or to a particular radio programme.

example.ex: I'm a regular listener to her show...
Each week Dr Buczacki chooses a listener's question and gives a detailed answer.
example.tran: 每个星期布柴齐医生都会选取一位听众的问题，给予详细回答。

entry.def: If you describe someone as a good listener, you mean that they listen carefully and sympathetically to you when you talk, for example about your problems.

example.ex: Dr Brian was a good listener...
example.tran: 布莱恩医生会耐心倾听他人说话。

example.ex: If you can be a sympathetic listener, it may put your own problems in perspective.
example.tran: 如果你能充满同情心地倾听别人的说话，也许就能够正确地认识自己的问题。

Sentence.sentence: The radio business has changed greatly and now attracts more listeners.
Some day you may be either a speaker or a listener in a situation involving people from other countries or members of minority group in North America.

While Gail Obcamp, an American artist was giving a speech on the art of Japanese brush painting to an audience that included visitors from Japan, she was confused to see that many of her Japanese listeners have their eyes closed.
By invading the personal space of listeners.

People who do not have access to a good listener may not only be denied the opportunity to heighten their self-awareness, but they are also denied valuable feedback as to the validity and acceptability of their inner thoughts and feelings.
